channel.title: Linux Kernel - Perfect Dark Mode
channel.description: Overview Linux systems can be organized into 3 levels of abstraction 1 Hardware (physical Layer) Memory, Hard disks, networking, parts, etc. 2 Kernel (Kernel Mode) - Process and memory management, device communication, system calls, sets up filesystem,etc. - Talks to hardware to make sure ut does what processes need it to do 3 User Space - Shell, Programs that you run, graphics, etc. Privilege Levels (protection rings) Kernel Mode (ring 0)
